comments:
20020412
check the 'single click launching'
select a junit test case file which does not have a main method
press run

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Main type not specified.
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.AbstractJavaLaunchConfigurationDelegate.abort
(AbstractJavaLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:60)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.AbstractJavaLaunchConfigurationDelegate.verifyMainType
Name(AbstractJavaLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:427)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.JavaLocalApplicationLaunchConfigurationDelega
te.launch(JavaLocalApplicationLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:35)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:140)
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.LaunchConfigurationDialog$8.r
un(LaunchConfigurationDialog.java:1821)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
(ModalContext.java:98)

In this case, an error dialog is shown ("no main method"), and then the config 
dialog is openned showing the error message. This is not terrible, but it would 
be more friendly to just open the dialog showing the error message.
